titleStmt.title: By the Lords Justices and Council. Mich. Armach. C. Granard: Whereas we the Lords Justices have lately received a proclamation published by his Majesty in England, dated the thirteenth day of June 1685. Which followeth in these words. James R. Whereas We have received certain information, that James Duke of Monmouth, Ford late Lord Gray outlawed for high treason, with divers other traytors and outlaws, are lately landed in an hostile manner at Lyme, ...
titleStmt.author: Ireland. Lords Justices and Council.
England and Wales. Sovereign (1685-1688 : James II). Whereas James Duke of Monmouth in order to excite and stir up our subjects to joyne with him in a rebellion against us, ...

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Benjamin Tooke, printer to the Kings most excellent Majesty; and are to be sold by Andrew Crooke and Samuel Helsham at the Colledge-Arms in Castle-Street.,

notesStmt.note: At end of text: Given at the Council-Chamber in Dublin, the 22th. day of June 1685.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
